page.title: 01BISHOP'S TAWTON AND LANDKEY
page.content: These two areas are mainly rural with some housing estates surrounded by many farms. The River Taw runs through Bishop's Tawton and the main railway from Barnstaple to Exeter also runs through Bishop's Tawton. Both Landkey and Bishop's Tawton have a Parish Church and there are also churches of other denominations in the area as well. In between Landkey and Bishop's Tawton is Codden Hill on which is the monument erected to the memory of Caroline Thorpe the wife of the former leader of the Liberal Party. Within the area is one of the two Comprehensive schools in Barnstaple and it serves the children of both Landkey and Bishop's Tawton and the surrounding villages.
